body: @robertwb looks like this got merged, so I can close it?
Yep, I just merged this so you have to close it now. (Apache doesn't give us write access to the repo, so I can't.)
Waiting on LGTM from @aaltay
Looks like this needs a rebase.
LGTM, jenkins is green and travis is a flake.
LGTM. Thank you.
@robertwb done.
Thanks, @robertwb. LGTM
Fixing merge conflicts. @robertwb : )

@davorbonaci Jenkins is slacking around here, not doing it's job ðŸ˜‰ 
Would you know something about it ?

@amitsela -- not sure, nothing has changed regarding this particular job recently. I think it's probably a temporary outage around asfbot. I'd probably wait a bit and see what happens.

The precommit is running jobs for other PRs as we speak: https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/

@davorbonaci I don't see a PreCommit running for this PR..
And now it's building something that was committed 7 days ago: https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1319
(it was committed 7 days ago, but it might have been pushed just now)
Test breakages are fixed. Remaining failure is a known issue, unrelated to my PR.
@sumitchawla  - have you found another workaround for this issue? I would love to move forward with this PR, as it does seem useful once we get it right and tested.
@kennknowles we did a workaround by moving all beam dependencies to user class path, and packaging them with user code

I've left some comments on particular commits, but between conflicts and the underlying PR, just to clear up my tooling, I am going to defer reviewer assignment for now.

R: -@kennknowles
ping @aaltay

I talked to @rangadi and he says that there was no practical reason for having the `byte[]` key/value type defaults (i.e. it's an artifact of the original implementation, rather than a convenience feature; and even if we wanted to have defaults for these types, it'd better have been `String`). This matches my finding that no code uses those defaults as-is. So that part should not be considered a regression.

@amitsela looks like this PR was not run through the precommit tests, and because of that it broke the build. E.g., the file TestPipelineOptions is missing a license header, and there are a bunch of unused and mis-ordered imports. I'll send a fix to this.
@jkff Jenkins is not running PreCommit for some reason..
@jkff when you build locally, do you fail on checkstyle ? I don't, as of today apparently...

https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1364 . I'm able to reproduce the checkstyle failure if I run with the same profiles as precommit:
`mvn -T8 -e -Prelease,include-runners,jenkins-precommit,direct-runner,dataflow-runner,spark-runner,flink-runner,apex-runner clean verify` (or `checkstyle:check`)
This is bad.. Contributors won't run this (I don't want to ðŸ˜¨ ) and so they'll miss checkstyle errors.
@jkff maybe change the title to match [BEAM-983](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-983) and I'll assign you and close #1362 ?

mvn -Prelease clean verify does the trick, much simpler. Can ignore the
rest of the command and get nearly all the tests. (Still pending proper
documentation in the contribution guide).

Jenkins had an outage today, so unfortunately we got unlucky on the
precommit testing. @davorbonaci is working on getting us the thing where we
can run "retest this please" if Jenkins misses it. Similarly, we really
just want mergebot to implement a submit queue for us.

On Tue, Nov 15, 2016 at 11:38 PM, Amit Sela notifications@github.com
wrote:

> This is bad.. Contributors won't run this (I don't want to ðŸ˜¨ ) and so
> they'll miss checkstyle errors.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1332#issuecomment-260793013,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAgITxXPCTUWjXQmQuYz-WXbkgJBJoiDks5q-jRPgaJpZM4Kuj0k
> .
Sounds better ðŸ˜„ but we have to document it, even I wasn't aware clean install will skip checkstyle from now on.

LGTM pending Jenkins (for real this time).
But let's make it a part of [BEAM-893](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-983).

FWIW I think our configuration is probably broken. The command `mvn rat:check` fails on `master` even after the rollback, even after running `git clean -d -f -x`.

It is quite hard to tell, as there is no documentation for the format of the report (that I know of) and it lists 26k lines of content that is explicitly ignored.

PTAL

marked registerIOFactoriesAllowOverride as deprecated.

I don't think you need the NoopCredentialFactory anymore since the default is to return null which implies to do the service calls with no credentials which is effectively what NoopCredentials is already doing.
R: @amitsela
First "ugly" attempt, base for discussion.

LGTM

@davorbonaci if you could take a look I'd appreciate it.
R: @robertwb @aaltay @jasonkuster @davorbonaci
This doesn't make much sense to me. @jasonkuster is (actively) working on separating the builds, which makes this obsolete.

This is temporary fix until we have Jason's work. Do we know when that is expected to be out? Until then, I think it is useful in not waiting for java tests to be run before we fail on python (unless I am missing something).

Fairly soon. I don't think this is the right "fix" to change what tests run and/or in which order. We can perhaps change how we invoke Maven to get the desired effect. Overall, test execution concerns shouldn't affect module layout.
R: @kennknowles
LGTM since Jenkins says yes
R: @kennknowles
LGTM when green
R: @aaltay @robertwb

Dang. Looks like I can't just move StateContext.createFromComponents away from the SDK.

The Jenkins failure is:

(546b2b14867c0a52): Exception: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.beam.sdk.util.state.StateContexts.createFromComponents(Lorg/apache/beam/sdk/options/PipelineOptions;Lorg/apache/beam/sdk/util/WindowingInternals;Lorg/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/windowing/BoundedWindow;)Lorg/apache/beam/sdk/util/state/StateContext;

Let's see what I can do about this...

@vikkyrk Please fix the pylint error.  

LGTM otherwise.
Done
Hold on, there's a bunch more dependency problems.

I certainly don't disagree. I was looking for a short term fix (without having visibility into jenkins commands). But I wasn't aware of the work you guys have been "already" doing in this front. Just read your email on beam mailing list, thanks. Closing this PR.

Creating a DataflowClient with null credential is considered as a error, since nothing is public with dataflow requests.

NoopCredentialFactory is used by DataflowRunnerTest to create a non-null fake Credentials.
I reduced the scope of this PR, now it doesn't do the things that break integration tests, but accomplishes most of its other goals. Let's wait for tests - it should work this time.
Fixed the various build warnings and a test error, PTAL.
Need to do some more substantive work. Closing for now.
LGTM pending green.
Green, PTAL.
Green, PTAL.
Green now.
The remaining test error is fixed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1367
New approach updating the `Dataset` interface and both `BoundedDataset` and `UnboundedDataset`.
Updated according to the last messages.
LGTM, merging

@jbonofre looking good!

R: @robertwb

Since Python already has nose for testing, introduce new test framework (pytest) will confuse people and not necessary. Will create a [new PR](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1376) that based on nose.
+R: @aaltay @robertwb
The test failure looks unrelated to me and it passes locally for me. Is that a known flaky test or should I take a closer look?
R: @dhalperi OR @kennknowles OR @lukecwik
I ran the flaky test with changes 10k times with no failures.
There's actually an unused import causing it to fail fast on checkstyle.
Yea, not worried about the Travis failure. But Jenkins did not run, probably due to some transient infrastructure issue. Can you rebase and force push to the branch? That will kick Jenkins again.
R: @aaltay
Awesome! LGTM
